content.description:
Thoughtful and fun moves the whole way, with a variety of interesting rock structures. 

  Start up just left of small tree onto big ledge.    . . (Variation 5.9+ : start on R side of arete).   Next step right to the arete, then up on that to a gentle spot. Next diagonal up left to another gentle spot.   . . Variation 5.8 fun: Instead go up right through overhang with notch, then back left to rejoin main route. 

  Up to left side of jaggy flake, follow that to the top. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).
content.protection:
For ideas to set up Top-Rope, see the Description of this Romance Novels sector . 

  Protection for Trad leading is unknown.
content.location:
6 feet left of arete in center (lowest point) of main (SW) side of sector, with a 2.5ft-deep dihedral / open book just above, and a substantial pine tree about 30 feet above. 

  - - > See on this Photo

  . . . . or on this Photo

content.description:
Interesting moves in a variety of rock situations. But the crux move is significantly harder than the rest. 

  Up the corner/crack to a big ledge. Walk left-ward across the ledge to center-right of a wide face. Up this about ten feet, then step right (crux) to a substantial left-facing corner. Up that to the top. 

  . . ?? (possible future variation ? . From the big ledge, aim for the big protruding block in the right wall of the substantial left-facing corner: but that big block might be loose, so need to check it from above carefully first -- with nobody anywhere below). ?? 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.location:
About twenty feet up steep dirt slope along left side of this Romantic Novels rock, under a left-facing corner/crack. 

  - - > See on this Photo

content.description:
Some thoughtful moves. Two different rock situations. 

  Up into the dihedral with crack and flake and past roof (fun 5.7).    Next up face (not using any holds from the easier roof) - crux.   Finish up face to left of jaggy flake (not using the flake or large holds near it) (5.8+) 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.location:
About 10-12 feet left of arete in center (lowest point) of main (SW) side of sector, below left from a 2.5ft-deep dihedral / open book just above, just below a wide book somewhat L-facting, with flake and 1-2-inch crack which leads up to a 1.5-ft-deep roof. 

  - - > See on this Photo

content.description:
Opportunity to climb on a non-difficult arete. If only it were longer. 

  Up the arete to a gentle section. Then up into a short narrow gully but exit left before its top. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.description:
Interesting moves in a variety of situaions. 

  Up to the roof.   . . Variation (5.10c): Up over left half of roof. 

  Next step left around to base of obvious left-facing corner / gully, then up through the overhang and up to a gentle section, and a little climbing to the top. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.description:
If you like wide / off-width cracks, or just want to practice your technique, you'll wish this crack were longer (and that the steep dirt approach were shorter). 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree).

Wide crack at the top of the steep dirt slope between the Adventure Stories rock and the Romantic Novels rock. Just right of a wider crack/chimney. 

  - - > See on this Photo

content.description:
Interesting moves in a variety of rock situations. 

  Up into the dihedral with crack and flake, but instead of continuing up that to the roof, step left to the edge of left face of the dihedral, then over that and left up the face to a big ledge. Up the left side of the face (just right of big right-facing corner) to the top.   . . Variation (one 5.10b move): up the center right of upper face to top. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

climbs.name: Going Steady
climbs.fa: TR Sharon + Ken Roberts, Karel Hrbacek

content.description:
Interesting climbing, but crux move is significantly harder than the rest. 

  Up to the bottom of corner/crack, then diagonal up right. Before reaching the level of the roof, step right (crux) across into steep (overhanging?) gully, and up that to gentle section. Trend a bit left with easier climbing to the top. 

  . . Variation: Start up the center of the face (5.8) 

  name of book: Sally Burnaby series. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

  - - > See on this Photo

content.description:
Less-than-vertical cliff with many features, some routes up to 60 feet tall. 

  Left (WNW) from the Good Book wall. Faces mainly SSW. 

Top Rope access: The least difficult is to go around way left (NW) under next obvious cliff (Adventure Stories) and up steep through cleft (lat long approx N41.1465 W74.1673) on its Left side (could be dangerously slippery with wet leaves or ice) to reach top of cliffs. Then walk horizontal right (SE) about 150 ft to get above this sector, then down a little to edge of cliff - (Tree anchor with static line). 

  Another way might be to climb the route Northwest Passage

  around the right end of the Adventure Strories rock, then traverse Right (E) along the top. 

  Or can scramble up around the Right side of this Romance Novels rock. 

warning: The rock around this sector has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber. 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).
